intro: Leptosema chapmanii, commonly known as the Chapman's lepidopteran plant, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
